solution_line_template: A spacecraft flying through normal space for {normal_space_hours} hours at {normal_space_speed}-billion miles per hour travels {normal_space_hours}*{normal_space_speed}=<<{normal_space_hours}*{normal_space_speed}={normal_space_distance}>>{normal_space_distance} billion miles.

A spacecraft flying through a black hole at {black_hole_speed_multiplier}*{normal_space_speed}=<<{black_hole_speed_multiplier}*{normal_space_speed}={black_hole_speed}>>{black_hole_speed} billion miles per hour.

Thus, a spacecraft flying through a black hole for {black_hole_hours} hours travels {black_hole_hours}*{black_hole_speed}=<<{black_hole_hours}*{black_hole_speed}={black_hole_distance}>>{black_hole_distance} billion miles.
Therefore, in total, the Zargon spacecraft will travel {normal_space_distance}+{black_hole_distance}=<<{normal_space_distance}+{black_hole_distance}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} billion miles.
